ygData.subject: Re: Adventure Tips?
ygData.msgSnippet: Most low lvl mobs can t see invisibility, so it s safe most of the time travelling with it on.  Since I haven t reach lvl 20, I can t comments on monsters
ygData.messageBody:
Most low lvl mobs can't see invisibility, so it's safe most of the time
travelling with it on. Since I haven't reach lvl 20, I can't comments on
monsters higher than that. So far I haven't meet any mobs that can see me
with invis.

Normally talking, ooc, etc wont reveal yaself. But if u try to loot,
inspect others, cast spells or attack, you will reveal yaself. It doesn't
give any AC bonus, only give u the ability to remain invisible to others.

As for CB, I mean soloing. If u can find a full group with tanks and
healers, u shld be able to survive quite well in the CB camp, but not in
the CB dungeon, due to the higher lvl mobs like dvinn, emperor etc. I ever
group with a team of 1 warrior, 1 ranger, 1 cleric, 1 wiz, 1 magi when I'm
lvl 5 and 6, we did quite well in CB camp.

Btw, maybe u wanna consider coming to FP when u reach lvl 8 and buy the new
scrolls, coz most of the kakis r in FP and we can help one another better.
I just met a high elf friend last night, who is 2 lvl above me when I
leave for FP, now she is 4 lvl below me. FP basically got more monsters to
hunt, better xp and loot too. Most imptly all our kakis are there, dun
have to worry abt been bullied, hehehe.

Ziltus


On Thursday, 01 July, 1999 10:10 PM, Synzzz [SMTP:hannibal@...]
wrote:
> From: "Synzzz" <hannibal@...>
>
> Hi LKW aka Ziltus!
>
> One question i really want answered: Does invisiblity really keep you
unseen
> to monsters?
> Like if i don't attack them..they won't see me? And if i do attack while
> invis..does it
> give any bonus of any kind eg. AC ??
>
> Thanks for the tips!! I can't cope with trains of 3 centurions now...so
i'll
> keep away
> like you said from CB...guess until lvl 10 loh =(
>
> Cya soon,
> Synzzz aka Zanderion (EQ)
>

> > Maybe I can suggest u to buy all the impt scrolls for ya next lvl, keep
in
> > bank and go FP for hunting. I'm now camping inside CB (ok, Crushbone,
not
> > ch** by* hor), and will take a boat back to FP either late tonight or
> > tomorrow. U can give me a tell if u dunno the way to port. I can bring
u

orc
> > cen will attack u on sight. For Einan I also keep casting invis on
him,
> at
> > least he is not tat bad since he can tank quite well and his lvl higher

> >
> > If u prefer to stay in Faydark, u can try to go BB. There is a place
with
> > few stone blocks, and inside the stone blocks center is a npc merchant.
> > I've been training there since lvl 7 to 9. The 4 skellies there spawn
at
> > fixed place and will not run ard, so pretty safe for u to kill one by
one.
> > H/w, the skellies r also lvl 7-9, that mean I have to team with a tank
b4
> > I go there. For magi, maybe ya pet can help u solo. Once u get above
9,
> > try the bandit camp between the highelf and woodelf city. There r 3
> > bandits there which r non-agro, but if u attack one, all 3 will come to
u.
> > U can bring a tank there safer. Once u get to lvl 10-11, u can try
> harder
> > places like mino cave for mino slaves or BB chestboard for skeleton
> > king/bishop (as a group hor).
> >
> > Personally I dun advised any caster below lvl 10 to go CB, coz the loot
> > doesnt justify the trains. I myself start to go there since lvl 5, and
> > died until I lost count liao. Unless u can solo a train of 3-4 orc
cen
> or
> > solo an orc leg, dun bother to go there. Places like bandit camps or
BB
> > skellies can give better loot, better xp and most impt, better SURVIAL
;)
> >
> > Ziltus.
> >
> > p/s: Already confirmed with GM that 2nd name must be one word, but can
> > separate using the ' sighn, like Ziltus de'Guailan, not bad right?
Hehe.
